TextBlock.Text: PILEA: I've been learning a lot about the insectoid creatures here since we build this observation post. I'm calling them "hoppers" since they, well, hop around.
PILEA: For instance, I've learned that that will travel between seeds to chase prey or flee from predators, unlike the anglerfish, which seem to be more territorial.
PILEA: As we've seen, they are highly reactive to light. I hypothesize they have evolved in reaction to the presence of anglerfish.
PILEA: I'll log any additional findings here as I discover them. Learning the xenobiology of this place is the best way I can help.
